iso_physical_virtual_substrates.definition: Isomorphic patterns between physical (biological/wet) and virtual (silicon/simulated) substrates capture structural equivalences in causal hierarchiesâ€”mappings where recurrence, embodiment, and irreducibility preserve (or diverge in) relations invariantly. These include recurrent integrations, feedback persistences, and self-referential unities vs. feed-forward reducibilities, validated via 2025 IIT/neuro-AI studies (e.g., Phi comparisons in wet vs. dry systems per web analogs) and cross-substrate analogies (e.g., biological spiking to ANN activations). Hard-to-vary invariants like causal persistence enable forecasts of phenomenal gaps; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm physical embodiment/deny virtual qualia/both in hybrids/neither in pure simulations); scores >0.98 based on 2025 abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to physical vs. virtual overlays across scales plus principle; concrete from IIT/web and substrate contrasts (e.g., wet recurrence to virtual forward-passes).
Validate coverage; flag phenomenal gaps as bounded/speculative (e.g., virtual qualia links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., self-reflection); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary wetware to 2025 dry AI).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Cross-substrate: Integration invariants with phenomenal divergence)

data.description: Persistent feedback integrations mapping invariantly in physical but reducibly in virtual.

examples.universality: Implicational: High recurrence yields irreducible unity

mappings.subatomic: Quantum coherence (physical proxies; virtual qubit simulations).
mappings.atomic: Molecular vibrations (physical bonds; virtual orbital models).
mappings.cellular: Ion channel loops (wet recurrence; virtual node clusters).
mappings.organism: Neural feedback (wet Phi; virtual ANN passes).
mappings.social: Cultural recursions (physical interactions; virtual MAS protocols).
mappings.principle: Causal striving for irreducible persistence (phenomenal in physical).

data.description: Sensory-grounded unities vs. abstract reducibilities; maps with qualia divergence.

mappings.principle: Embodied striving for felt unity (gapped in virtual).

gaps: Phenomenal divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm physical embodiment/deny virtual qualia/both in hybrids/neither in pure simulations.
